We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Officer (Construction)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a proactive and organized Project Officer to support the coordination and execution of an ongoing construction project.
	The ideal candidate will assist in monitoring project progress, coordinating site activities, ensuring compliance with safety and quality standards, and liaising with stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of milestones.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in planning, scheduling, and coordinating project activities and resources.
	Monitor site activities to ensure compliance with project plans, safety protocols, and quality standards.
	Track progress and report project updates, issues, and delays to the Project Manager.
	Coordinate logistics for inspections, deliveries, and site meetings.
	Identify potential risks and assist in implementing corrective measures.
	Liaise with contractors, vendors, and consultants to ensure smooth communication and timely execution.
	Support in maintaining documentation including work permits, site logs, reports, and minutes of meetings.
	Assist with procurement follow-ups and ensure timely delivery of materials to site.
	Prepare and maintain daily, weekly, and monthly progress reports.
	Ensure that all site operations are carried out in line with regulatory and environmental standards.


Requirements


	B.Sc./HND in Civil Engineering, Building Technology, Project Management, or related field.
	1&ndash;3 years of relevant experience in construction project coordination or site supervision.
	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, Project); familiarity with construction software is a plus.
	Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing project demands.
	Basic understanding of construction methods, project lifecycle, and health and safety standards.
	Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@elvaridah.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Project Officer (Construction) Job at Elvaridah




        
    

        
        At Elvaridah, we emphasize on the critical matters and prospects of organizations such as business growth, strategy, planning, marketing, structure, and people management across different industries. We help companies focus on the growth of their businesses while aligning costs with strategy. With our all-inclusive approach and expertise, we capture values across the boundaries of any organization. Elvaridah focuses on optimizing all the different parts of a business as a unit.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Officer (Construction)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a proactive and organized Project Officer to support the coordination and execution of an ongoing construction project.
	The ideal candidate will assist in monitoring project progress, coordinating site activities, ensuring compliance with safety and quality standards, and liaising with stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of milestones.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in planning, scheduling, and coordinating project activities and resources.
	Monitor site activities to ensure compliance with project plans, safety protocols, and quality standards.
	Track progress and report project updates, issues, and delays to the Project Manager.
	Coordinate logistics for inspections, deliveries, and site meetings.
	Identify potential risks and assist in implementing corrective measures.
	Liaise with contractors, vendors, and consultants to ensure smooth communication and timely execution.
	Support in maintaining documentation including work permits, site logs, reports, and minutes of meetings.
	Assist with procurement follow-ups and ensure timely delivery of materials to site.
	Prepare and maintain daily, weekly, and monthly progress reports.
	Ensure that all site operations are carried out in line with regulatory and environmental standards.


Requirements


	B.Sc./HND in Civil Engineering, Building Technology, Project Management, or related field.
	1–3 years of relevant experience in construction project coordination or site supervision.
	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, Project); familiarity with construction software is a plus.
	Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing project demands.
	Basic understanding of construction methods, project lifecycle, and health and safety standards.
	Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Digital Marketing Executive Job at Maybrands Limited




        
    

        
        Maybrands is the No.1 Retailer of FOSSIL products in Nigeria. We are the only licensed store to sell fossil products in Nigeria, these Include;Fossil,Skagen, Emporio Armani, Diesel, Michael Kors, DKNY, Armani Exchange, Chaps, Nixon. You can find all your fashion accessories for both women and men.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Marketing Executive

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Directly Reports to: Managing Director / CEO, Business Development Manager

Job Description
     

            
    




	Your Job is to plan to plan, develop and implement all aspects of digital marketing strategy to reach more people, increase our income, and build stronger relationships with our audiences.


Responsibilities


	Lead the planning and execution of the digital marketing strategies to promote Maybrands services to customers.
	Plan, organize and manage all e-mail campaigns, events, social media pages and relevant creative content per the marketing calendar to drive traffic and increase conversions on the website.
	Manage online customer acquisition and retention programs including SEO, email, affiliate marketing, graphics and social marketing.
	Use Google Analytics and other business tracking tools to make strategic and tactical recommendations.
	Benchmark, measure and analyze results of online marketing initiatives such as e-mail campaigns, events, promotions, SEO marketing, affiliate program and future online marketing initiatives.
	Cooperate with the web developers to make necessary changes in the website if necessary.
	Investigate, recommend and implement new enhancements that can increase revenue, brand awareness and improve overall customer experience by analyzing the results of ongoing efforts.
	Email Marketing: Plan and manage a regular schedule of email marketing activity, growing our subscriber base and creating engaging, relevant content including testing to optimize results.
	Perform keyword research in coordination with Maybrands business objectives to optimize existing content and uncover new opportunities.
	Provide SEO analysis and recommendations in coordination with elements and structure of websites and web pages.
	Provide recommendations and execute/manage strategies for content development in coordination with SEO goals – general and keyword specific.
	Help to create and support marketing content to socialize and use for social media purposes (e.g. customer videos briefs, customer case studies, blog posts, posts from analysts and customers).
	Keeping up to date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing and measurement.
	Undertaking any other duties commensurate with the accountabilities of the post.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 2 - 5 years of work experience.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Head of Finance, Africa

What You&#39;ll Do
Financial Strategy &amp; Leadership:


	Act as a strategic partner to Zipline&rsquo;s Africa leadership team, advising on financial planning, investment decisions, and business growth initiatives.
	Lead financial forecasting, budgeting, and performance analysis to optimize financial resources and ensure the sustainability of Zipline&rsquo;s Africa operations.
	Identify and implement cost-saving and efficiency strategies to improve profitability while maintaining operational excellence.
	Develop long-term financial models to assess different market strategies and guide expansion efforts.


Accounting &amp; Compliance:


	Partner with local accounting teams to improve financial reporting accuracy, streamline processes, and ensure timely financial close cycles.
	Work with Zipline&rsquo;s US-based finance leadership to standardize financial practices across global operations.
	Participate in audit processes and liaise with regulatory bodies to ensure transparency and compliance.
	Coordinate with local and US-based Tax advisors to ensure Tax compliance across entities


Operational Finance &amp; Business Partnering:


	Serve as a financial thought leader for Zipline&rsquo;s operations in Africa, helping local teams navigate financial complexities and drive sustainable growth.

	Develop roadmaps and strategies for Zipline to launch Platform 2 in Africa.


What You&#39;ll Bring


	8+ years of experience in finance, including 2+ years in a financial leadership role within a multinational or high-growth company.
	Knowledge of accounting principals and direct experience working with IFRS and local accounting regulations in African markets.
	Experience managing financial operations for an international company with African market exposure.
	Proven ability to partner with in-country finance and accounting teams while partnering with global finance leadership.

Head of Finance Job at Zipline




        
    

        
        Zipline - Do you want to change the world? Zipline uses drones to deliver critical and life-saving medicine to thousands of hospitals serving millions of people in multiple countries. Our mission is to provide every human on Earth with instant access to vital medical supplies. Join Zipline and help us make this a reality for billions of people.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Finance, Africa

Job Location: Lagos

What You'll Do
Financial Strategy & Leadership:
     

            
    




	Act as a strategic partner to Zipline’s Africa leadership team, advising on financial planning, investment decisions, and business growth initiatives.
	Lead financial forecasting, budgeting, and performance analysis to optimize financial resources and ensure the sustainability of Zipline’s Africa operations.
	Identify and implement cost-saving and efficiency strategies to improve profitability while maintaining operational excellence.
	Develop long-term financial models to assess different market strategies and guide expansion efforts.


Accounting & Compliance:


	Partner with local accounting teams to improve financial reporting accuracy, streamline processes, and ensure timely financial close cycles.
	Work with Zipline’s US-based finance leadership to standardize financial practices across global operations.
	Participate in audit processes and liaise with regulatory bodies to ensure transparency and compliance.
	Coordinate with local and US-based Tax advisors to ensure Tax compliance across entities


Operational Finance & Business Partnering:


	Serve as a financial thought leader for Zipline’s operations in Africa, helping local teams navigate financial complexities and drive sustainable growth.
	Partner with engineering, supply chain, logistics, and deployment teams to ensure cost-effective operations and strong unit economics.
	Work closely with government, donor and commercial partners to structure financially viable contracts and partnerships.


Scaling & Profitability of Zipline’s Business:


	Conduct strategic financial analysis to enhance the scalability and profitability of Zipline’s Platform 1 operations in Africa.
	Develop insights into market expansion opportunities, pricing strategies, and operational efficiencies to drive sustainable business growth.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess the financial feasibility of launching new products and services in Africa.
	Develop roadmaps and strategies for Zipline to launch Platform 2 in Africa.


What You'll Bring


	8+ years of experience in finance, including 2+ years in a financial leadership role within a multinational or high-growth company.
	Knowledge of accounting principals and direct experience working with IFRS and local accounting regulations in African markets.
	Experience managing financial operations for an international company with African market exposure.
	Proven ability to partner with in-country finance and accounting teams while partnering with global finance leadership.
	Excellent financial modeling, forecasting, and strategic analysis skills.
	Experience working with operations-heavy businesses (e.g., supply chain, logistics, or manufacturing).
	Ability to influence executive stakeholders and work cross-functionally across finance, operations, and commercial teams.
	Strong communication and leadership skills, with the ability to operate in fast-paced and evolving markets.
